titleStmt.title: A. P. Cooper et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9128

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
His Excellency B Magoffin
Gov. of Kentucky --

Sir Your petitioners John M Phipps and Eliza Hampton was arrested in the fall of 1861 and brought before B Hamons J P. for trial under a charge of fornication and the trial terminated in a fine of Ten Dollars Against each of your petitioners and an Executions issued agt. each of us for said fines And is now in the hands of the Sheriff of Magoffin County Ky. & Who will proceed to collect the Same unless restrained by your Honor and ^We^ humbly ask your honor to interpose & remit the Said fines & We further Say We will not be fined for Such offences any More

The undersigned Join in the prayer with the above petitioners for the remission of their fines Owing to the fact that they are poor & Needy and has Solemnly avowed to Join together in the holy State of Matrimony

A. P Cooper Esqr.
Samuel Salyer
B F Howard
Miles Williams
H P Williams
J C. Stamper
Jacob Wireman
David Reid

Magoffin J P Ct
$10 each } Fornication
Jno. M Phipps
Eliza Hampton
